review_text: This really has helped me sleep. I havent been able to go to bed on my own recently, I'd go to sleep around 3am and have to wake up around 7am and continue on with my day. It was miserable. I ordered these and it knocked me out. The first time, I took one around 10:30pm and was out probably around 11pm. I woke up feeling great, still a little tired but not as bad as I wouldve usually been. Ive been taking them about 20-30 minutes before I actually want to go to sleep and boy do these take you to sleep. The feeling of it is like you're tired but then once it hits you, you're so tired that youll actually just close your eyes and thats it. You wake up to your alarm or naturally (whatever you got to do the following day). The taste is nonexistent, its a clear capsule with a white/eggshell powder inside. I dont take pills without something to drink so I cant really answer how easy it is to swallow alone. Overall, it was a great investment to me. Just remember everyones body is different so just because it works for a person, it might not work for another.

review_text: I'm happy with the quality of this product. It's as described. As someone with severe insomnia, I've tried everything there is. Even at 10mg It takes a few doses for it to get me to sleep. I like that I'm aware that I'm drifting off. With Ambien one minute I'm wide awake and the next minute it's 8 hours later. What I don't like about this melatonin is that while a few doses gets me to sleep it doesn't keep me asleep. Perhaps I should try for the extended release since I can't seem to stay asleep for longer than 4 hours on these. On the plus side, though I'm wide awake at 4am, I'm not groggy or later in the day. One note of caution/strong suggestion would be to up your fiber intake while on these capsules. Add an extra dose (or 2 or 3 doses) of chia seeds or start loving bran muffins

review_text: I suffer with chronic insomnia, and have since adolescence (I'm middle-aged, now). So, I've been taking melatonin for over a quarter century at this point. product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: STAY AWAY. Item is NOT returnable and DOES NOT WORK. I have had sleep issues since a child, and long ago discovered Melatonin helps me greatly. I'm also a top Amazon reviewer – check my history. I've taken melatonin daily for years. THIS IS JUNK. I've used countless melatonin brands, and currently still have some 3mg Nature's Made. Doing the math, this Puritan's Pride was the best value per MG, but I can tell you right now that my 3mg Nature's Made has more effect. WASTE OF MONEY. I'm straight edge (no drugs, no alcohol) and do not take any other medicine, so I know my body very well on what is working and what isn't. Usually, I take 2x 3mg Melatonin and have for years and within half an hour I'm sleepy, and I can fall asleep within 10-15min. So logically, taking 1 of these at 10mg should knock me out. I've taken 1 every night for the past 4 days, and nothing. Last night after 45 minutes I finally took a 3mg Natures Made, because I felt nothing on these. Seeing "fulfilled by Amazon" you expect a certain amount of coverage by Amazon – I've had a prime account for almost a decade in one form or another, and am very disappointed I cannot return this product. It absolutely does not work, I feel more with 3mg of Nature's Made, and further the expiration on my Nature's Made is Jan 2021 and this bottle of 240 tablets lasted me about 6 months... this Puritan's Pride junk is 03/19 so it must be VERY OLD. Save your money and buy from a more reputable seller / reputable brand, they are offloading old junk and hoping you won't notice. TRASH.

My son was already taking this because he has trouble falling to sleep so I 'borrowed' some of his before ordering my own. I was shocked and amazed to feel quite sleepy within thirty minutes after a 10mg dose. I have discovered one thing with this. As soon as you feel sleepy you need to shut down and try for sleep. review_text: My MD has make take Melatonin at night to help with my rest. I really like this Brad and will continue to use. It's delivered with such care. I will be back to purchase again. Thank you.ize: 120 Capsules I need 3mg, my partner and mother-in-law both need 5mg, dose can be age-dependant. These 10mg capsules are for pa-in-law who is being treated for prostate cancer (see more on this below). In "The Miracle of Natural Hormones", Dr Brownstein writes that it is effective for about 60% of patients with sleep difficulties and he often observes that melatonin alone does not always improve sleep until he adds DHEA, when melatonin becomes much more effective. (Dr Jonathan Wright and Dr Brownstein both caution against taking more than 5-10mg DHEA daily unless you are getting tested regularly.) Melatonin is a master-hormone produced by the pineal gland deep in the brain. It is mostly produced at night, but only in the dark. If you have street lights blazing into your bedroom or sleep with a nightlite on, you're in trouble. If you work nights or stay up very late, you're also in trouble. If your health isn't great, ditto. While most people don't need to pay extra for the liquid or the sublingual or the time release versions, it's worth experimenting if the first type of melatonin you try doesn't work for you (whatever you are hoping for). Melatonin needs to be taken at night, around bedtime. It is the most important hormone for good sleep but, in addition to the well-known jet-lag and sleep benefits (for restless/disturbed sleep as well as insomnia) for which melatonin benefits about 60 per cent who try it, melatonin also has some age-reversing benefits, enhances sexual vigor, relieves stress and anxiety, helps with pain relief (the effect is stronger at night), and is even useful for hormonal cancers such as breast cancer and prostate cancer. In the very expensive book "Melatonin in the Promotion of Health" ($180), there are chapters discussing melatonin's role in bone and dental health, gut health, digestive issues, mental/emotional health, sun and pancreatic protection, cellular repair, heart protection, and protection from eye inflammation and immune system problems as well as the better known breast cancer and sleep disorders. People with fibromyalgia experience a significant reduction in their symptoms when taking a melatonin supplement and melatonin can reduce some symptoms of IBS, such as abdominal pain. Melatonin increases the conversion of precursor thyroid hormone T4 to the active T3 form. It can reactivate the important but much-ignored thymus gland, which degenerates almost completely over the years. It also improves zinc absorption, which in turn boosts several immune functions. Melatonin therapy also helps spleen recovery, another immune-system component which declines with age. Its ability to improve sleep and dreaming is a tremendous boon to memory. It is one of the most powerful antioxidants made by the body. However, melatonin decreases cortisol so those with a known cortisol deficiency (stopthethyroidmadness website has home self-tests for adrenal fatigue) should take melatonin only in conjunction with something like Cortef, although I believe Pregnenolone, the mother hormone for steroid and sex hormones, is more useful - and so much cheaper too. The book "Melatonin Miracle" recommends starting with an initial dose of 1.5 mg. There is a warning that melatonin is rarely useful before age 40 (except for children with Down Syndrome, ADHD and Autism). Note: From my research, it seems that adrenal fatigue is most responsible for difficulty falling asleep as well as a lot of insomnia and disturbed sleep. stopthethyroidmadness (website and book) has a lot of practical information about adrenal issues (which go hand-in-hand with low thyroid for at least 50 per cent of sufferers). Most people make enough melatonin up to age 40. Taking too much will make you feel muddled and distracted in the daytime but there are no known serious side effects. Dosage suggestions - to make up for the fact that less and less melatonin is made in the body as we age - are: .5 to 1mg for ages 40-44, 1 to 2mg for 45-54, 2 to 2.5mg for 55-64, 2.5 to 4mg for 65-74 and 3.5 to 5mg for 75+ - and melatonin must only be taken at night, just before bedtime. (warning: doses between 1 - 5 mg may cause seizures in children) The 4mg+ dosage is only recommended for the 70+age-group who produce very little melatonin naturally at night. 5-10mg is suggested for those with some cancers - and other research shows success with 20mg melatonin every night taken by men with prostate cancer (which tends to be the elderly) along with conventional hormone treatment (drugs to block testosterone, which in the longer-term - 1-2 years later - spreads the cancer throughout the body - unless melatonin is also given). Therefore, we continue (with doctor's permission) to give 20mg nightly (a huge dose) to pa-in-law who is receiving shots to block testosterone (albeit I'd bet he has little or none at his age) in the hope of preventing the otherwise apparently inevitable spread of cancer later. While melatonin did not help with his sleep patterns, an anti-anxiety drug certainly did! [later note: Dr Hertoghe, who has published several books on hormones, including the basic "The Hormone Solution" sold here, suggests sublingual melatonin (or drops) in very low doses of between 0.05 - 1mg a day as being highly effective. It works 10-15 minute after intake. He advises that the slow release version lasts too long (continued drowsiness after waking) and rates it as having low effectiveness. Finally, he explains that the fast release melatonin should be taken in dosages of between 10 mg (often 1mg) daily. This has medium effectiveness and works 30-60 minutes after intake (for some, up to 2 weeks to begin seeing sleep benefits). However, both cortisol support and thyroid support reduce the effectiveness of melatonin.] It's generally claimed that the half-life of melatonin is anywhere from .5 to 2 hours but Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center states that the elimination half-life is approximately 45 minutes with a total body clearance of 10 hours for a 10mg dose. This is much more likely, since many people on melatonin are finally able to enjoy a full night's sleep - without having to take the time-release version. HOWEVER, unless you get the full 7 or 8 hours (whatever your body actually needs) you can feel groggy and uncomfortable when woken. Final note: those serious about learning how to avoid health problems - or how to recover - would also benefit from reading "Hypothyroidism Type 2" which shows how much of poor health and all chronic pain is linked to low thyroid, including insomnia, poor sleep, those involved with diabetes, heart problems, both bleeding (like gums, periods) & blood clots (including strokes) and some cancers. Also visit the website stopthethyroidmadness I look up the review from the other poster found it is true. My self with thyroid,insomnia and cancer. I wanted to send this back out. [...] Thank you.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: This Melatonin 10mg works very well for me and is a very good price for the amount. I don't necessarily think it's "super strength" like it says, but maybe that's just because I've taken it too long and have developed a tolerance. I take several supplements and vitamins and have taken way too many over the past few years and done quite a bit of research into various brands. Puritan's Pride is one that I have read good things about in all areas including the purity of the ingredients and lack of heavy metals or other contaminants when tested by outside companies. It's been so long since I've read about it so I apologize I don't have sources handy, but it is relatively quick and easy to Google. I think it's super important to research not only what supplements you take but also what brands, since the industry is not monitored by the FDA. There are so many major, well-known brands that don't contain the amounts or active ingredients they say they do, or even scarier, contain dangerous contaminants like lead, and yet they're still sold everywhere. Anyway, sorry I am rambling. You can see why I might have trouble sleeping, haha. But I do recommend these, they work well and I never feel drowsy the next day from taking them, plus they're relatively small capsules and easy to swallow.

review_text: After being a Puritan's Pride vitamin supplement customer for several years, and after reading positive customer reviews about this Melatonin product helping them sleep, I gave it a try. I took two capsules on the second and third night, same result, the product did not help with sleeping at all. Bottom line, after taking Puritan's Melatonin, I am not experiencing any change in my sleep pattern which is disruptive most nights. Will move on and try to find a product that works.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I've always had trouble sleeping, still do. I've taken the OTC liquids and night-time pills but I, like most people, quickly build a tolerance to them and I'm quickly back to poor sleeping again. I started buying Melatonin at my local vitamin shop at around $10 - $20 a bottle depending on whether or not there was a sale at the time. In conversation one day, my sister happened to mention that she also was taking melatonin to help her sleep. She sent me the link and I was skeptical because the cost was less than half of what I was paying and I've always believed that you get what you pay for. For $4, I was willing to roll the dice and see if they would work for me. I was pleasantly surprised to find that not only do they work as good as the ones I was getting from the store, but they actually worked better! With the original ones I was waking up after about 5 or 6 hours of sleep. These pills must have a something that allows it to release slower than others giving me a better nights sleep. My wife, who for the most part has no issues sleeping, likes to try and sleep in on the weekends. She will take one on a Friday or Saturday night and it allows her to sleep an extra couple hours in the morning. Overall, I would highly recommend!
review_header: Great value and a great product

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: Melatonin is generally pretty inexpensive, but this is a real bargain--10 mgs? No one sells 10 mgs! But for overnight workers like myself (formally, anyway) this is a must-have to regulate your backwards sleep cycle. Plus, it really gives you a solid 6-7 hours of sleep (almost 7, exactly) consistently--unless you're under a lot of stress or drink a lot of caffiene. (In that case you're kinda on your own I guess.) But I've used a lot of different melatonins over the years, and this is a great choice as far as I'm concerned.

review_text: This is a great alternative to OTC sleeping pills, and the value can't be beat. If you are trying to get to sleep at night but are worried about side affects, these rapid release Melatonin tablets are great.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: These are the best melatonin supplements. They are rated the #1 supplement in LabDoor. Many other melatonin supplements have less than the advertised concentration of melatonin, according to the LabDoor testing. Some claimed to have 10mg but ended up only having 6-7mg. In contrast, the Puritan's Pride brand had 10-11mg -- the advertised dosage to possibly even more! These were also rated the best in terms of cost effectiveness. At such a cheap price, I will be buying this brand of melatonin and no other! It's a very low price to pay for better sleep. This supplement will help anyone suffering from jet lag, shift work, or insomnia caused by circadian rhythm issues. But if your body is naturally producing melatonin at the right times already and your sleep problem is caused something different, then this is not going to do anything for you. My sleep doctor recommended that I take it in high dosages -- 10-20mg per night. I was diagnosed with delayed sleep phase syndrome, where my Circadian rhythm is later than most people. My natural melatonin production doesn't occur until 3-4am, so I have little hope of falling to sleep earlier without the supplement. By taking this every night, I can adjust my body's natural rhythm to be more in line with what society and corporate America expects. He recommended taking an initial 10mg dose 2 hours before bedtime and a 2nd 10mg dose 30 minutes before bedtime. This has really helped. He also recommended taking some slow release melatonin 30min before bedtime as well to help get me through the night.
review_header: Top rated melatonin according to LabDoor testing

First night I woke up with sweats and feeling nauseated, I thought maybe I was getting the flu or something. Horrible dreams when I did sleep. Tossed and turned and had a horrible night. I read some articles about melatonin and 2-3 mg seems to be the max that is recommended for most benefit, so I'm going to go back on Schiff Super. product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: If you've ever got tired after Thanksgiving dinner (and had turkey), it's because of this chemical - Melatonin (or at least a close relative). I've bought numerous brands of this vitamin over the years and have found the Puritan's Pride is the most consistent in quality and the way it works with my body. For this reason, I keep coming back for refills, if you will. This particular vitamin is in a capsule which can be opened and added to your nighttime milk, tea, or whatever and you probably won't notice the taste. Or you can take the capsule as it comes from the bottle. product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I frequently have trouble falling asleep. Someone recommended melatonin, so I decided to give it a shot. As long as I remember to take it about 30 minutes before I want to go to sleep, it works like a charm. I've tried prescription remedies in the past and they leave me feeling groggy in the morning (or even worse if you have to wake up during the night). I've had to wake up for phone calls an hour after falling asleep with the melatonin and feel zero effects. I've heard it doesn't work for everyone, but if you have trouble falling asleep, this is definitely worth a try!

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I take one of these and I am not long for the waking world. I have tried other companies' melatonin, but they didn't work. If you try an herbal supplement and it doesn't work for you, it may not be that the supplement doesn't work but that the company is actually just using filler, or mostly filler, and the product is not what it is advertised to be. Some studies show that up to 60% of supplements have little of the advertised ingredients in them, and sometimes they do not have any of the advertised ingredients in them. Knowing this, after not having good results from melatonin supplements, I decided to try again, this time with Puritan's Pride. I have purchased Puritan's Pride Melatonin twice now, and each time, it works, when other companies' versions did nothing for me. Good price, plus they work.
review_header: They work and boy do they work.

review_text: Just one of these pills knock me out in less than 30 minutes and I stay asleep for at least 6 hours which is really unusual for me. The pills are a bit larger than I’d prefer but there’s no aftertaste so that’s good. I’m buying these again.

review_text: These worked great for me and I have insomnia so it takes alot to knock me out. So I was very sceptical about ordering these but when you have insomnia and rarley sleep, you find yourself getting desperate for some shut eye. I chose these because they were geared to people with low to moderate insomnia issues and I must say that I was impressed. They did not make me grawgy the next day and I did not get any headaches. I will be buying these again. I want to say that this review is coming from someone diagnosed with insomnia and has taken perscription sleep meds like ambian, trazadone, etc. so over the counter would never work for me but research and hunting pays off sometimes because those perscription sleep meds are just awful. They may allow you to sleep but they can really mess with your head. So take it from me these are just a AMAZING!

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: These capsules have been literally a life saver for me. I was moody, depressed, could get to sleep and when I got to sleep I couldn't stay asleep. I've had numerous surgeries in the last 5 years and since these surgeries I just couldn't seem to be able to relax. Mr doctor gave me a myriad of tests to see if I am depressed, anxious, or some other problem. She said that she could put me on anti-depressive medication but wanted me to try the Melatonin first.They come in 3, 5 and 10 mg. capsules. I take the 10 mg. IF you are sensitive to medication you would probably do better if you take the smaller dosage. I process medication quickly - thus the 10 mg for me. For about a week after I started taking them, I fell asleep immediately but only slept for 2-3 hours before waking up. The next morning I had a slight 'hangover'. I've been on them about 6 weeks now and I have never felt better!! I sleep at least 6-7 hours a night (which to me is a miracle!!) and it's good, restful sleep. I dream normal dreams now instead of the nightmares I used to have. I take the capsule about 1/2 - 1 hour before I plan to sleep. I honestly think this has saved me from having to take chemically produced prescription drugs and they are much less expensive. I would highly recommend them - IF your doctor says they might work for you. I'm so glad I tried these FIRST.
review_header: Melatonin for a good, restful night's sleep

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: Instead of taking just one pill (10mg) I took three because I really needed the sleep. Well that was four hours ago and is now 2:30am... and I am wide awake writing this review. I don’t know what’s in these pills and just can’t believe all the positive reviews. Most likely written by employees. I wouldn’t take another one of these pills if they gave me free bottles of them. They just don’t work. Remember I took three... that’s 30mg. Think I should still be asleep instead of writing this???? Duh!!!
review_header: What a waste of money ... stay away ...

review_text: Tried these once before circa August 2020. They were fine, so I bought them again (in October 2021), a 2-pack this time. The pill tasted unbelievably foul the moment it hit my tongue. Oddly, no odor whatsoever, but taste was incredibly strong. Not bitter but stinky like degraded rubber or some kind of rancid oil. The spot where it touched my tongue was stuck with this horrible aftertaste for over an hour. I'd try to get my money back but it's not worth the effort trying to return an opened bottle of pills. It'd be one thing if they were just low quality or overpriced. These are actively disgusting and probably harmful to your health. You couldn't get me to swallow another one if you paid me. I don't normally post amazon reviews, but I felt obligated as a member of the human species to do my part in preventing another person from ingesting this foul industrial contamination.
review_header: Tastes like they accidentally contaminated it with rubber

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: ***Picture for size comparison*** With all the high reviews I thought this may actually work well. I failed to notice that these aren't dissolvable tablets, but pills. I definitely prefer the tablets to pills when it comes to melatonin. I'd say this took me over an hour to get remotely sleepy both times I've taken it. I'd rather take dissolvable melatonin and be sleepy 20-30 min later than wait over an hour to get tired. I guess it's just personal preference. Two stars instead of one beacuse it does actually make you tired, just takes too long. Upped it to four stars: Why? Because I got used to taking capsules instead of quick dissolve. It does make you sleepy within about an hour but if you fight it, you'll still be awake but yawning.

review_text: I’ve completely changed my lifestyle and diet within the last 7 months and now have a very hard time falling/staying asleep. Any small noise can wake me up, and then I’ll be up for 30 mins to an hour before I can fall asleep again. I started taking things like Z-Quil or a sleep-aid gummy but I felt like they really only helped me fall asleep, but within 3-4 hrs if I woke up throughout the night I’d still have a hard time going back to sleep. These typically don’t help me become sleepy, but once I fall asleep I am OUT. Every now and then I get up in the middle of the night to use the restroom, but I never have a hard time falling back asleep. These are truly amazing and have helped with not only the quality of sleep I’ve been getting, but also the duration. I love these and would definitely recommend them to anyone who has a hard time sleeping.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I have a lot of trouble sleeping. I have asthma, allergies, and I wear a mouth guard for grinding my teeth at night. Most difficult, I have a Mood Disorder, Anxiety Disorder, and I take a lot of medication that can make it difficult to fall asleep and/ or stay asleep. This past year has been proven increasingly difficult for my sleep. I started taking Melatonin about 6 months ago. I take the 10mg tablet about an hour before bedtime and I notice it starting to work within twenty to thirty minutes. I start to feel a little drowsy most nights, Sometimes I don't really feel tired, but if I go to bed anyway, I fall asleep within ten minutes. I can attribute this to the Melatonin, because without it, I still have trouble falling asleep. I like taking it because I have a lot of anxiety, including panic attacks, at night, and it helps me relax. I would say that it keeps me sleeping for about two hours after going to bed. If I wake up to go to the bathroom later in the night, it can be hard to fall back asleep. Basically, it isn't going to fix every sleep problem you have. It will help ease you into your bedtime routine and help you fall asleep. But, at least for me, it hasn't helped with the waking in the middle of the night.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: As someone who has always struggled with falling asleep, it's great to finally have found something that works. These are strong enough even for me. They've made all the difference in being able to finally establish a regular sleep schedule.

review_text: VERY STRONG. Large quantity for the price. Well known and respected brand for melatonin. I know the research says you only need <1mg as an effective dose, but after various brands, dose sizes, and smaller doses of the same brand, I found it just wasn't cutting it, and many times I would need a second dose to make it through the night. These things kick in LIKE A TRAIN around the one hour mark and once they do it's lights out regardless of what I'm doing at the time. Make sure you have everything taken care of for the night before using these :P . I do notice some very slight grogginess when waking up, as many users report from high mg doses, but it is no where near what I have experienced from other brands. Some brands leave me feeling like I was out drinking all night, while the occasional grogginess I get from these is pretty easy to shake off within the first fifteen minutes of being awake. Side note: I have tried both the time release version and the "rapid + time release" version, and neither provided near the knock out power nor the duration of effect that these do. I will absolutely be reordering this when the time comes. 120 nights of awesome sleep in a bottle.
review_header: Fantastic melatonin supplement. Personally, nothing short of 10mg does the trick for me, regardless of the research.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I honestly don’t know whether melatonin helps with or improves the quality of my sleep. But since I have sleep apnea and two other sleep disorders, and my sleep doc insists I take melatonin, I take it. Having spent my entire working life in healthcare or a related field, I know that all supplements are NOT created equal. But the Puritans Pride brand has long had a reputation among pharmacists and physicians for using good quality ingredients, observing FDA GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), and complying with or exceeding the few regulatory standards that exist regarding nutritional supplements. I’ve been using this brand’s vitamins for years with no untoward effects, and I’ll continue to use their products unless and until they give me a reason not to.
review_header: It’s a good value for the price

review_text: I was very encouraged by all of the positive reviews. I suffer from severe insomnia and my daughter dies as well. I purchased two bottles, one for myself and one for my daughter. Unfortunately, they did absolutely nothing for either of us. We both tried for a week, taking two of these a night and noticed absolutely no difference at all. I even went a step further, and consulted with my doctor and took three a night, still nothing. Quite disappointed.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I've struggled with sleep all my life, tried everything (except for Melatonin) and had people rave about it to me for years. I finally decided to give it a try. The reason I held off for so long was because, while I had dozens of people touting Melatonin's benefits, I also heard about the flip-side -- even more disturbed sleep than without Melatonin. So, I thought, why would I risk that? Desperate times call for desperate measures, and I was willing to give it a go. I've also heard about how it can negate the effects of jet lag, so I decided to give it a shot since I travel a decent amount. Long story short, I was the "worst case." Each time I took this Melatonin, I woke up at 3:30am like clockwork and could never fall back asleep. I decided to experiment and take it earlier in the evening, and that was even worse. The one night I did, I woke up at 1am and was up the rest of the night on one hour of sleep; the next day was a disaster. Yikes. Waste of money. I'm just glad I bought the smaller bottle. (I nearly went for the 120.)
review_header: Terrible effects from this product. Could not sleep at all.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: So far I love these. I have found that opening the capsule and mixing the melatonin powder into my hot herbal tea before bed has been the best method for me, personally. The reason for this, is that I drink tea before bed most nights to calm down and also mixing the powder in is a good way to get me to not waste a drop of tea -- because usually I get distracted and once I put my cup down my tea goes cold and I end up dumping the rest. The MAIN reason I like to mix this powder with my tea is that it acts faster for me. I am (albeit gently) knocked out in about 20 - 25 minutes, whereas one night when I switched up the routine and took the capsule straight up with water -- I didn't feel the effects for about 30 - 40 minutes. With my new job, heavier workload, and tendency to stay up till 2 - 3 a.m, this Puritan's Pride melatonin has really been doing it for me lately. So happy I found this, (I used to chew 2 strawberry melatonin gummies by the brand Sundown Naturals before bed, 5 mg each = 10 a night) because my old routine of taking melatonin wasn't as effective and contained sugar and other ingredients I could honestly do without. Keep in mind that everyone's body and metabolism is different, so you may find taking the capsule more effective. ALSO REMEMBER TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS, PLEASE TAKE ONLY (1) ONE CAPSULE PER NIGHT AS DIRECTED, 10 MG IS STRONGER THAN YOU THINK. Happy sleeping!

review_text: I had a scrip for Ambien before and took myself off it because of a really bad sleepwalking experience. I'm not the only one. Look up YouTube videos on it and see for yourself. I'm thankful my wife was there, or else I could have gotten into a lot of trouble. Seriously. That stuff should be taken off the market as dangerous. Anyway, I needed something because I'm such a light sleeper. Took a chance with these and am very happy. Some say Melatonin doesn't work, but here's the trick I've found after taking these for several months: Take these when you go to bed and are ready to actually sleep. Do what I do and read your Kindle. After about 20 minutes it starts to take affect. Right when you feel it, close the Kindle and turn off the light and crash. If you insist on reading the next chapter you'll find the sleep window closes rather quickly. Taking another will not have the same effect. Trust me on this.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: Even as a caffeine addict and as someone who likes to stay up late, these manage to make me sleepy. I've struggled my whole life of laying in bed and not being able to fall asleep when I need to for work the next day and stuff. With these I can legit go to bed at 9PM if I want to. I take one and start feeling a little drowsy with eyelids feeling heavier within about 30 minutes. It's not too bad though and I usually stay up over an hour doing stuff before I turn in. Within about 5-10 minutes I'll be asleep in conditions/times that would have been impossible before. Seems like it mostly wears off after about 3 hours and I might wake up but I've always been able to get back to sleep really easy if I do and the residual effects probably help too. Next morning there is no drowzy or weird feelings that Zzzquil would leave me with. The taste isn't too bad but there's still a little funk to it so I take with a flavored drink. I don't review too many things but had to for this since it's changed my life in terms of actually being able to fall asleep at the necessary 'bedtime' for work nights. I can stay up all night on the weekend until 5AM and go back to going to bed at 9PM on Sunday night with no problems.
review_header: First time trying Melatonin and these work good for me.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: This is an OVERDOSAGE. About .2mg melatonin is enough to completely replace your body's natural melatonin production. That means most people should not take more than .1mg Using over 1mg is completely unnecessary, and will do more harm than good. Do your research. Taking fifty times as much melatonin as your body needs will jack up your sleep cycles towards your time to wake up. You will wake up feeling hung over. Just because this hormone occurs naturally in your body doesn't mean it will be harmless to pump fifty times as much into your system as your body would normally produce. Really most people have no use for melatonin. It does not cause drowsiness. It is a hormone that tells your brain that it is night time. The main purpose for melatonin is helping jet lag, or shift workers who must adjust their sleep to a new time. Their bodies won't be producing the amount of melatonin needed because that isn't their normal bedtime. There are some other medical conditions like Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome which may benefit. Also the elderly may find benefit from taking .1mg at night because we produce less melatonin as we age. That should be enough to bring blood levels up to normal. Human Growth Hormone is perfectly natural. Would you pump yourself full of fifty times your normal level? DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFORE INGESTING HORMONES One source: http://delayed2sleep.wordpress.com/2010/04/11/melatonin-less-is-sometimes-more/

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I had low expectations. For the last dozen years or so, I have been having trouble falling asleep, especially when there is a lot happening at work. I have been taking Lunesta several times each week for maybe 10 years, and I gave this product a try, fearing potential side effects of using Lunesta for so long. As with Lunesta, I would take a capsule before going to bed and play with my iPad. Within 30 minutes, I am sound asleep. I have been using this for about a week now and, with the exception of one night, I have been able to sleep through the night and wake up feeling refreshed! On one occasion, I woke up around 2 am and had trouble falling asleep again. So, around 2:30 am, I took another capsule...and I was able to go back to sleep rather easily. This could have been due to the placebo effect and I’m not even sure if it is safe to take 2 capsules this way, but I was able to wake up the following morning on schedule, feeling good. All in all, this product has been working beautifully so far and I am hoping it will continue to work, so I can go “clean” and not rely on potentially harmful medication.

review_text: I take this every night otherwise I just never sleep. Most melatonin’s have zero effect on me but two of these bad boys get me down quick (within 30 minutes). Highly recommend pairing with a “rain on leaves” youtube sleep video. I haven’t been this rested in my entire life, and it’s helping so many other parts of my life fall into place. I’m able to enjoy my job more not being miserably tired, able to have the time and energy to consistently work out, my adult acne has gotten so much better, no longer living off pure caffeine (I was finally able to quit coffee) and I finally conquered my “what if I can’t fall asleep and I’m too tired to preform well tomorrow” anxiety and actually get enough sleep to guarantee my best foot forward on a daily basis. Highly recommend to all my sleep deprived fellow humans!

review_text: I work through the night so I need help going to sleep and switching up my sleep cycle when I do things with my wife during the day. These work really well for me, and you get a freaking ton in the two pack. product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I have used melatonin of many different brands for several years. Generally, it works well as long as I only use it occasionally and for short periods of time with breaks in between, otherwise I seem to get tolerant no matter what dose/brand. I do seem to have some degree of tolerance even after not taking it in a long time because I seem to need a higher dose now. That said, this product definitely acts more quickly and maybe even seems to have a slightly stronger effect than the same dose of other brands. I do worry about the long-term effects of taking such (relatively) high doses, but for occasional insomnia this product is effect and reasonably priced as compared with other brands of melatonin.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: This is the first time I've ever tried melatonin. I've had pretty bad insomnia for a few months and the over the counter sleep meds make my legs restless. But, I've found that 10mgs is far too much for me to get to sleep-it actually keeps me awake. I did a search and read experts saying that we only need a few mgs a night. Or, it could possibly have the opposite effect, which is exactly what happened to me when I tried taking these for the first several nights. Once I looked it up, I started breaking open a capsule and sprinkling a bit of it on some peanut butter about an hour before bedtime. The difference was crazy. After about 45 minutes, I could hardly keep my eyes open. I will definitely repurchase, but I will also keep sprinkling it on a small bit a peanut butter. I sleep so much better than I have in years. I can't believe the difference a few mgs make. I highly recommend this product to others, but only using the smaller incremental doses, as I believe the experts have it right.
review_header: 10mgs is too much-keeps you awake! Cut the dose and sleep like a baby.

This has been then best brand for me. Here's my observation/experience: One pill will kick in 20 mins after ingesting. It's mild enough to where you can spook it if something comes up but will make your eyelids feel heavy if you are relaxed in bed. The effect is good for 4 hours; thus allowing the brain to stay asleep and wake up less groggy. If you have bigger problems like me, you know 4 hours is better than nothing.

review_text: Just got these in and took one last night for the first time. Let me tell you… I KNOCKED OUT!!!! The pill worked much quicker than I expected and much more effective than I could have imagined. I’ve been struggling with insomnia for about two weeks but last night this pill allowed me to fall asleep quick. I woke up multiple times throughout the night but was sooo sleepy I couldn’t even open my eyes, I just fell right back to sleep. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I was really groggy in the morning and have a headache. I needed a giant cup of coffee to function but the headache has me back in bed. But if you don’t mind that, buy it because it does it’s job for sure! Update: after submitting my review I ended up feeling really nauseous for the day. I looked it up and too much melatonin can cause the headache & nausea. I honestly don’t see myself taking the pills again because I felt like poo and I don’t think it was worth it personally.

product_title: Puritan's Pride Super Strength Rapid Release Capsules Melatonin 120 Count (Pack of 2)
review_text: I am a very light sleeper and this helped. I don’t get 8hrs of effect on myself but works very well. Helps me fall asleep fast and get some good hours of continuous sleep. Also don’t wake up drowsy like others.
